inputs.name: projectName
inputs.label: Project Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Either select an existing project name or type a name to create a new scan project

inputs.name: syncMode
inputs.label: Synchronous Mode
inputs.helpMarkDown: Enabling this option causes the build step to wait for scan results. You can follow the scan results in the Checkmarx plug-in results window. If disabled, the results are displayed inside the Checkmarx web application and available as a link in the logs once the scan is complete. The Sync/Async mode is configured globally for both SAST and SCA scans.

inputs.name: enableProxy
inputs.label: Enable proxy
inputs.helpMarkDown: Check box for adding the ability to enable/disable proxy use. (Proxy Settings are configured on the agent level).

inputs.name: proxyUrl
inputs.label: Proxy URL
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide URL of the proxy server. For example,for PAC proxy (Proxy Auto Config) enter URL in format http://prac-proxy-hosting-server:port/<name of proxy pac file> or for standard http proxy enter URL in format http(s)://proxyhost:proxyport.For http proxy that requires authenctication define variables 'proxy-username' and 'proxy-password' in the pipeline.Ignore this field if you have configured proxy details at the Self-Hosted Agent.

inputs.name: enableSastScan
inputs.label: Enable SAST scan
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select in order to enable the CxSast scan

inputs.name: CheckmarxService
inputs.label: Checkmarx SAST Endpoint
inputs.helpMarkDown: The CX server endpoint.

inputs.name: sastProxyUrl
inputs.label: SAST Proxy URL
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide URL of the proxy server for SAST scan. For example,for PAC proxy (Proxy Auto Config) enter URL in format http://prac-proxy-hosting-server:port/<name of proxy pac file> or for standard http proxy enter URL in format http(s)://proxyhost:proxyport. For http proxy that requires authenctication define variables 'proxy-username' and 'proxy-password' in the pipeline. Ignore this field if you have configured proxy details at the Self-Hosted Agent.

inputs.name: preset
inputs.label: Preset
inputs.helpMarkDown: predefined sets of queries that you can select when Creating, Configuring and Branching Projects. Predefined presets are provided by Checkmarx and you can configure your own. You can also import and export presets (on the server).If preset is mentioned in Service connection, then this will get overridden with Service connection Preset

inputs.name: customPreset
inputs.label: Custom Preset
inputs.helpMarkDown: Custom presets are provided in cases where the desired preset is missing from the Checkmarx presets above. Leave empty in order to use a Checkmarx defined preset. In case a custom preset is selected, it will override the Checkmarx preset.

inputs.name: engineConfigId
inputs.label: Source character encoding (Configuration)
inputs.helpMarkDown: Source character encoding for the project.

inputs.name: fullTeamName
inputs.label: Team
inputs.helpMarkDown: The full team name (for example, CxServer\SP\Company\Users). If team is mentioned in Service connection,then this will get overridden with Service connection Team

inputs.name: sastCaChainFilePath
inputs.label: CA Certificate Chain File Path
inputs.helpMarkDown: Certificate Authority (CA) Certification Chain file path in PEM format. The chain file should contain all intermediate CA certificates and root certificate for the CxSAST Service. For example: d:\certlocation\cacert-chain.pem . This parameter is must when CxSAST is configured with Self-signed certificate.

inputs.name: overrideProjectSettings
inputs.label: Override Project Settings
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select if project settings like Preset, EngineConfigurationID are to be updated in the CxSAST project. For new project, settings will be always saved on the CxSAST project.

inputs.name: incScan
inputs.label: Incremental Scan
inputs.helpMarkDown: Set true for incremental scan. If no scan was done yet, the scan will be a full scan and the following ones will be incremental.

inputs.name: fullScansScheduled
inputs.label: Schedule periodic full scans
inputs.helpMarkDown: Set true for incremental scan. If no scan was done yet, the scan will be a full scan and the following ones will be incremental.

inputs.name: fullScanCycle
inputs.label: Number of incremental scans between full scans (1-99)
inputs.helpMarkDown: Incremental scans are faster, but with time they become less accurate.Therefore, after a number of incremental scans it is recommended to perform a full scan.Here you can schedule periodic full scans to be executed after a certain number of incremental scans.Alternatively, if you want to run full scans on weekends, you can create 2 separate jobs.First job - to run incremental scans on weekdays and second job - to run full scans on weekends.
inputs.visibleRule: enableSastScan = true && fullScansScheduled = true && incScan = true

inputs.name: forceScan
inputs.label: Force Scan
inputs.helpMarkDown: Enabling 'force scan' will force the engine to trigger new full scan.

inputs.name: folderExclusion
inputs.label: Folder Exclusion
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Comma separated list of folders to exclude from scan. Entries in this list are automatically converted to exclude wildcard patterns and appended to the full pattern list provided in the 'Include/Exclude Wildcard Patterns' setting.

Conversion is done as follows: `folder1, folder2, folder3` is converted to: `!**/folder1/**, !**/folder2/**, !**/folder3/**`

inputs.name: fileExtension
inputs.label: Include/Exclude Wildcard Patterns
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Comma separated list of include or exclude wildcard patterns. Exclude patterns start with exclamation mark `!`.
Example: `**/*.java, **/*.html, !**\test\**\XYZ*`

#### Pattern Syntax
A given directory is recursively scanned for all files and directories. Each file/directory is matched against a set of selectors, including special support for matching against filenames with include and exclude patterns. Only files/directories which match at least one pattern of the include pattern list, and don't match any pattern of the exclude pattern list will be placed in the list of files/directories found.

When no list of include patterns is supplied, `**` will be used, which means that everything will be matched. When no list of exclude patterns is supplied, an empty list is used, such that nothing will be excluded.

The filename pattern matching is done as follows:
The name to be matched is split up in path segments. A path segment is the name of a directory or file, which is bounded by a path separator (forward or back slashes can be used).
For example, `abc/def/ghi/xyz.java` is split up in the segments `abc`, `def`, `ghi` and `xyz.java`. The same is done for the pattern against which it should be matched.

The segments of the name and the pattern are then matched against each other. When `**` is used for a path segment in the pattern, it matches zero or more path segments of the name.

When a name path segment is matched against a pattern path segment, the following special characters can be used:
- `*` matches zero or more characters
- `?` matches one character.	
####Examples
- `**\*.class` matches all `.class` files/dirs in a directory tree.
- `test\a??.java` matches all files/dirs which start with an `a`, then two more characters and then `.java`, in a directory called `test`.
- `**` matches everything in a directory tree.
- `**\test\**\XYZ*` matches all files/dirs which start with `XYZ` and where there is a parent directory called `test` (e.g. `abc\test\def\ghi\XYZ123`).

inputs.name: scanTimeout
inputs.label: Scan Timeout In Minutes
inputs.helpMarkDown: Abort the scan if exceeds specified timeout in minutes

inputs.name: projectcustomfields
inputs.label: Project Level Custom Fields
inputs.helpMarkDown: This field allows user to store metadata about projects. Add project level custom fields and its value. Example: field1:value1,field2:value2

inputs.name: customfields
inputs.label: Scan Level Custom Fields
inputs.helpMarkDown: Add scan level custom fields and its value. Example: field1:value1,field2:value2 (Note that the feature works with 9.4 version SAST onwards.)

inputs.name: denyProject
inputs.label: Deny new Checkmarx projects creation
inputs.helpMarkDown: Enabling this option will prohibit creation of new projects in Checkmarx, or assigning an existing project to a different team. Disabling this option will allow this action.

inputs.name: comment
inputs.label: Comment
inputs.helpMarkDown: Free text comment that will appear within CxSAST scan information

inputs.name: postScanAction
inputs.label: Post Scan Action
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select Post Scan Action name that is to be performed automatically after a scan.(Note that the feature works with 9.3 version SAST onwards.)

inputs.name: generatePDFReport
inputs.label: Generate CxSAST PDF report
inputs.helpMarkDown: Downloads a PDF report with scan results from the Checkmarx server. The report is available via a link on 'Checkmarx Scan Results' page. (Only available if synchronous mode is enabled)

inputs.name: vulnerabilityThreshold
inputs.label: Enable CxSAST Vulnerability Thresholds
inputs.helpMarkDown: Set the maximum number of CxSAST vulnerabilities of given severity before the scan fails (Only available if synchronous mode is enabled)

inputs.name: failBuildForNewVulnerabilitiesEnabled
inputs.label: Fail the build for new SAST vulnerabilities
inputs.helpMarkDown: This will fail the build if new vulnerabilities found. Enables the option to fail the build according to the defined severity (or higher). This option works in addition to the regular thresholds (e.g. if 'x' total high vulnerabilities were found OR at least 1 new vulnerability, fail the build).  This option is only available if the 'Enable vulnerability threshold' parameter is enabled.

inputs.name: failBuildForNewVulnerabilitiesSeverity
inputs.label: Fail for the following severity or greater
inputs.helpMarkDown: This will fail the build for following severity or greater. (e.g. if 'MEDIUM' is selected then any new vulnerabilities found for 'MEDIUM' and 'HIGH' severity will cause the build to fail)
inputs.visibleRule: vulnerabilityThreshold = true && enableSastScan = true && failBuildForNewVulnerabilitiesEnabled = true

inputs.name: high
inputs.label: CxSAST High
inputs.helpMarkDown: Define a threshold for the high severity vulnerabilities. The build will be marked as failed  if the number of the high severity vulnerabilities is larger than the threshold.

inputs.name: medium
inputs.label: CxSAST Medium
inputs.helpMarkDown: Define a threshold for the medium severity vulnerabilities. The build will be marked as failed  if the number of the medium severity vulnerabilities is larger than the threshold. Threshold must be 0 or greater to set a threshold, or leave blank for no thresholds

inputs.name: low
inputs.label: CxSAST Low
inputs.helpMarkDown: Define a threshold for the low severity vulnerabilities. The build will be marked as failed  if the number of the low severity vulnerabilities is larger than the threshold.  Threshold must be 0 or greater to set a threshold, or leave blank for no thresholds

inputs.name: enablePolicyViolations
inputs.label: Enable Project's Policy Enforcement
inputs.helpMarkDown: Mark the build as failed if the project's policy is violated. Note: Assigning a policy to a project is done from within CxSAST. (Only available if synchronous mode is enabled).

inputs.name: avoidDuplicateScans
inputs.label: Avoid duplicate project scans in queue
inputs.helpMarkDown: Avoid duplicate project scans in queue.

inputs.name: enableDependencyScan
inputs.label: Enable Dependency Scan
inputs.helpMarkDown: Use CxSCA to scan for risks in external dependencies

inputs.name: dependencyServerURL
inputs.label: CxSCA Server URL
inputs.helpMarkDown: CxSCA API endpoint. The node running the plugin is required to have connectivity to this address. The scanned code will be delivered to this address for analysis as part of the scan flow

inputs.name: scaProxyUrl
inputs.label: CxSCA Proxy URL
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide URL of the proxy server for CxSCA scan. For example,for PAC proxy (Proxy Auto Config) enter URL in format http://prac-proxy-hosting-server:port/<name of proxy pac file> or for standard http proxy enter URL in format http(s)://proxyhost:proxyport.For http proxy that requires authenctication define variables 'proxy-username' and 'proxy-password' in the pipeline.Ignore this field if you have configured proxy details at the Self-Hosted Agent.

inputs.name: scaTeam
inputs.label: Team
inputs.helpMarkDown: CxSCA Team name.If team is mentioned in Service connection, then this will get overridden with Service connection Team

inputs.name: scaCaChainFilePath
inputs.label: CA Certificate Chain File Path
inputs.helpMarkDown: Certificate Authority (CA) Certification Chain file path in PEM format. The chain file should contain all intermediate CA certificates and root CA certificate for CxSCA service. For example: d:\certlocation\cacert-chain.pem .

inputs.name: isEnableScaResolver
inputs.label: Enable SCA Resolver
inputs.helpMarkDown: To perform SCA scan through SCA Resolver which provides option for exploitable path

inputs.name: pathToScaResolver
inputs.label: SCA Resolver Path
inputs.helpMarkDown: Folder path on the Agent machine where ScaResolver is installed. For example: C:\Users\Installations\ScaResolver-win64 or /opt/ScaResolver-linux64.

inputs.name: scaResolverAddParameters
inputs.label: SCA Resolver Additional Parameters
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide arguments to ScaResovler tool in the same format as supported by the ScaResolver tool. ScaResolver tool will be executed in offline mode. '-s', '-n' and '-r' are mandatory parameters. Example:  -s C:\Users\SampleProject -n ProjectName -r c:\output, where -s: Path to the source code, -n: name of the project and -r: local machine path where the evidence file must be stored

inputs.name: scaConfigFilePaths
inputs.label: Package Manager's Config File(s) Path
inputs.helpMarkDown: This parameter is to provide configuration files of the package managers used in the project.For ex. Settings.xml for maven,Nuget.config for Nuget,.npmrc for npm etc.This option is relevant for projects that use private artifactory.Use CxSCA agent to perform the scan. CxSCA agent will try to perform dependency resolution using the package manager's configuration files provided. Multiple comma character separated file path can be provided. 'Example:c:/user/.m2/settings.xml,c:/user/npm/.npmrc'

inputs.name: scaEnvVariables
inputs.label: Private Registry Environment Variable
inputs.helpMarkDown: This option is relevant only if Package Manager's config files are provided. In many cases, package manager's configuration files reference environment variables, often to provide credentials without storing them in a file. Pass all such variables using this option.Example: param1:value1,param2:value2

inputs.name: includeSource
inputs.label: Include Sources
inputs.helpMarkDown: When this flag is enabled, it will include entire source code in the zip file to be scanned.

inputs.name: scaExploitablePath
inputs.label: Enable Exploitable Path
inputs.helpMarkDown: Exploitable Path feature will attempt to co-relate CxSCA scan with the available CxSAST scan results. In this section, provide details like CxSAST server url, credentials. At the job level, two more parameters need to be configured. These project full path name and/or project id from CxSAST.Example of Project Full Path: CxServer/team1/projectname

inputs.name: CheckmarxServiceForSca
inputs.label: Checkmarx SAST Endpoint
inputs.helpMarkDown: The CX server endpoint.

inputs.name: dependencyAccessControlURL
inputs.label: CxSCA Access Control URL
inputs.helpMarkDown: CxSCA Access Control URL, The node running the plugin is required to have connectivity to this address

inputs.name: dependencyWebAppURL
inputs.label: CxSCA Web App URL
inputs.helpMarkDown: CxSCA Web App URL. The node running the plugin is not required to connect to this address. It is used for report links

inputs.name: dependencyTenant
inputs.label: CxSCA Account
inputs.helpMarkDown: Account name of your CxSCA credentials

inputs.name: scaProjectFullPath
inputs.label: Project Full Path
inputs.helpMarkDown: Project Full Path with team value

inputs.name: scaProjectId
inputs.label: Project ID
inputs.helpMarkDown: Project ID

inputs.name: scaEnablePolicyViolations
inputs.label: Enable CxSCA Project's Policy Enforcement
inputs.helpMarkDown: Mark the build as failed or unstable if the project's policy is violated.Note: Assigning a policy to a project is done from within CxSAST

inputs.name: scaVulnerabilityThreshold
inputs.label: Enable CxSCA Vulnerability Thresholds
inputs.helpMarkDown: Set the maximum number of CxSCA vulnerabilities of given severity before the scan fails (Only available if synchronous mode is enabled)

inputs.name: scaHigh
inputs.label: CxSCA High
inputs.helpMarkDown: Define a threshold for the high severity vulnerabilities. The build will be marked as failed  if the number of the high severity vulnerabilities is larger than the threshold.

inputs.name: scaMedium
inputs.label: CxSCA Medium
inputs.helpMarkDown: Define a threshold for the medium severity vulnerabilities. The build will be marked as failed  if the number of the medium severity vulnerabilities is larger than the threshold. Threshold must be 0 or greater to set a threshold, or leave blank for no thresholds

inputs.name: scaLow
inputs.label: CxSCA Low
inputs.helpMarkDown: Define a threshold for the low severity vulnerabilities. The build will be marked as failed  if the number of the low severity vulnerabilities is larger than the threshold.  Threshold must be 0 or greater to set a threshold, or leave blank for no thresholds
